content: HIC www.hisa.org.au/hic/ - it's coming up 25-27 July.

There's a couple of FHIR events there - a combined "this is what FHIR could to for the user experience" and a FHIR technical thing organised by HL7 Australia and something on Monday around informatics.
and there's hacking health, of course, which is FHIR related
I'm also wondering if people are interested in an informal FHIR user group meeting while were (all?) there - catch up on what's going on with FHIR in this country
I can organise if there's interest (HISA talked to me about it)

Any interest in a FHIR hack at HIC 2016 hacking health - Melbourne 25-27 July?
http://hhmelbourne.sparkboard.com/
I'll be there, but haven't looked at the projects yet - tonight
would like to do a SMART on FHIR story..... anyone haveknow any web apps good for hooking up with GP data; even if they have no FHIR?
meaning - happy to get those non FHIR apps up to speed with some FHIR additions....
I'm not sure if this is relevant to this discussion, but the growth charts that were on the PCEHR, seemed to have disappeared on the new release of the MyHealth Record.

@Grahame Grieve - I do love the growth chart.... @David McKillop that would be a bit strange to loose that.. those growth charts would be a great candidate for conversion to a SMART on FHIR application attached to the My Health Record OR a local system source. Could use a profile as per Argonaut and convert the CDA documents with observations to FHIR. That would be Accenture source I imagine?
Or a consolidated view of both at the same time!
as far as i know, the blue book stuff is not a candidate for FHIR yet

@Brett Esler - my mistake, the growth charts are present on the new My Health Record. I just didn't look around enough and following someone else telling me they were there, I did find the details of the growth charts.
Apologies for the misinformation.
